overview: Across Indonesia, hundreds of villages are facing conflicts with corporations seeking to control their resources. When they fight, they have to face the consequences. In Tanah Ibu Kami, from The Gecko Project and Mongabay, journalist Febriana Firdaus meets women who have risen to lead social movements facing violence, imprisonment and judgment from conservative societies as they fight for their rights.
title: Tanah Ibu Kami
